• Second Read
  • Bio

For a decade (1998-2008), I worked at Spanish newspaper El Mundo. I was part of the launching team of elmundo.es, led the 24/7 expansion of the online world affairs coverage and managed the health channel —the largest health news website in Spanish-language

Since 2008, I've been pursuing an interdisciplinary path involving biotechnology, public health research, and data and social startups, as a member of the launching team of mapping platform CartoDB and co-founder of non-profit porCausa

I'm a lecturer on digital and data journalism at several universities, including Knight Center for Journalism in the Americas at the University of Texas in Austin, IE Business School (Madrid), and Universidad de La Sabana (Colombia)
